name: A "Q" Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What bird did the Hebrews eat while they roamed the desert (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
quail.

	You can read about this in Exodus 16:13 or Numbers 11:31-32. Quail can mean any of a number of types of small game bird. God also sent them manna to eat.

questions.text: What should you do if you have a quarrel with someone, according to Colossians 3:13 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
forgive.

	We are to forgive others because Christ forgave us. The other person may or may not know you forgave them, but forgiving them clears your head of the wrongful doing so that you don't hold a grudge and become miserable as a result.

questions.text: According to Joshua 18:15 (KJV), what area was part of the south?
questions.explanation:
Kirjathjearim.

	Kirjathjearim was known as the city of forests.  It was one corner of the south quarter of the lands given to the tribe of Benjamin, on the boundary with the lands given to the tribe of Judah.

questions.text: According to Acts 8:27 (KJV), who was Candace?
questions.explanation:
Queen of Ethiopia.

	Philip met a eunuch who had "great authority under Candace the Queen of Ethiopia." This was the only time Candace is mentioned in the Bible.

questions.text: What does I Thessalonians 5:19 (KJV) tell us not to do to the Spirit?
questions.explanation:
quench Him.

	The Spirit can be quenched when Christians stop praying, reading the Bible or joining in fellowship with other Christians. When this happens it becomes easier and easier to sin.

questions.text: What did the Pharisees do many times in the New Testament to Jesus?
questions.explanation:
questioned Him.

	The first time in the Gospels that we see this is Matthew 22:35. He asked Jesus what the greatest commandment was. Jesus told him not only what the greatest was but also the second greatest.

questions.text: What does I Thessalonians 4:11 (KJV) say to study to be?
questions.explanation:
quiet.

	The next part of the verse says "and do your own business". So basically the verse is saying keep your mouth shut when need be and mind your own business.

questions.text: Fill in the blank from Genesis 31:15 (KJV): "Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath _______ devoured also our money.
questions.explanation:
quite.

	Leah and Rachel were looking for a part of their father's inheritance. They say they were sold because in essence Jacob bought them by working seven years for each sister.

questions.text: Along with his bow, what did Isaac ask Esau to take with him and get some venison, according to Genesis 27:3 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
quiver.

	The quiver is the container that the arrows go into. It was while Esau was hunting that Rebekah was telling Jacob what to do to get Isaac's blessing (that should have gone to Esau as he was the first born).

questions.text: In Habakkuk 3:16 (KJV), what did his lips do when he heard?
questions.explanation:
quivered.

	It also said his belly trembled when he heard the voice. Habakkuk is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Bible.
